meanings.definition: A soft, thin piece of paper used for wiping or cleaning.
meanings.sent1: She used a tissue to wipe her tears away.
meanings.sent2: He always carries a tissue in his pocket in case he sneezes.
meanings.sent3: The tissue floated gently to the ground like a delicate feather.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a tissue, soft and comforting in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The tissue crumpled in her hand, absorbing the spilled drink.

meanings.definition: A group of similar cells that work together to perform a specific function in the body.
meanings.sent1: The muscle tissue in his arm helped him lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: Doctors examined the tissue under a microscope to understand the disease better.
meanings.sent3: The tissue of friends and family came together to support her during tough times.
meanings.sent4: Their bond was like tissue, each part essential to the whole.
meanings.sent5: The tissue of the heart beat as one, keeping the body alive.
